channel.title: Combined Indian Markets Feed
channel.description: Top 50 items from LiveMint and Moneycontrol

item.title: SC directs no coercive action against owners of 10-year-old diesel, 15-year-old petrol vehicles in Delhi-NCR
item.description: The Supreme Court of India, on Tuesday, 12 August, has directed that no coercive action can be taken against owners of 10-year-old diesel vehicles, and 15-year-old petrol vehicles in Delhi-NCR.

item.title: Centre plans to spotlight 100 PM Internship Scheme beneficiaries during I-Day celebrations
item.description: By showcasing real-world examples, the Prime Narendra Modi-led government hopes to shift the narrative from theoretical education to practical skills that meet market demands.

item.title: Nykaa Q1 Results: Net profit surges 79% YoY to ₹24 crore, revenue rises 23%. Check details here
item.description: Nykaa Q1 Results: Net profit surges 79% YoY to ₹24 crore, revenue rises 23%. Check details here

item.title: Indian stock markets close lower following broader decline in Asian markets
item.description: The Indian stock market closed lower on Tuesday, following a broader decline in Asian markets, as investors focus on July's domestic inflation data and the US inflation report, which could influence market participants' decisions.

item.title: Mint Explainer: The risks of investing in low-rated corporate bonds—and the safeguards available
item.description: Low-rated corporate bonds are surging, with 450 issued in FY25. While they offer investment opportunities, they also come with risks like covenant breaches and potential downgrades. Mint explains the risks associated with such bonds

item.title: All is not well at AYUSH ministry: Acute staff shortage plagues autonomous bodies as 45% posts stay vacant
item.description: With 45% of posts vacant in the Ministry of Ayush's autonomous bodies, major shortages exist in NEIAFMR and ITRA. A recruitment drive for more than 300 vacancies is scheduled, and applications are accepted until 31 August 2025.

item.title: Gurugram man, who flashed at woman, arrested days after video went viral
item.description: The arrest was made days after the model uploaded a video of the masked man flashing her while she was waiting for a cab.

item.title: Shreeji Shipping Global IPO: From subscription information to financials, here are 10 key things to know from the RHP
item.description: Shreeji Shipping Global IPO: From subscription information to financials, here are 10 key things investors must know from the RHP before subscribing

item.title: Fake FDs, loan scams, missing crores: HDFC probes fraud at Kashmir's Shopian branch, two ex-managers booked
item.description: A multi-crore fraud involving fake fixed deposits and unclosed loans has been discovered at HDFC Bank's Shopian branch in South Kashmir. Two former managers are under investigation, and account holders have reported discrepancies dating back to 2020.&nbsp;

item.title: Manager's one-line reply to employee seeking leave goes viral, internet reacts
item.description: A manager's simple yet thoughtful response to an employee's leave request has sparked widespread praise online.&nbsp;

item.title: Mint Explainer: Why are private hospitals resisting the government's health insurance scheme Ayushman Bharat
item.description: Ayushman Bharat, India's flagship health insurance scheme for the poor, is facing a crisis as over 600 private hospitals in Haryana have suspended services due to unpaid dues. With over ₹1.2 trillion owed to hospitals nationwide, what does this mean for the future of healthcare access for millions?

item.title: After stray dog relocation order in Delhi-NCR, Supreme Court cracks down on leftover food disposal in court premises
item.description: The Supreme Court, on Tuesday, 12 August, has issued a fresh directive aimed at curbing canine roaming within its own premises — mandating that all leftover food be disposed of in covered bins only.

item.title: Sensex drops 368 points, Nifty ends at 24,487— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
item.description: The Sensex ended the day at 80,235.59, down 368 points, or 0.46 per cent, while the Nifty 50 settled at 24,487.40, down 98 points, or 0.40 per cent. The BSE Midcap index dropped 0.25 per cent, and the Smallcap index rose 0.04 per cent.

item.title: Cabinet approves four semiconductor factories in THESE states
item.description: Cabinet approves four semiconductor factories in THESE states

item.title: ‘Go back to India’: Canadian teenagers find online support after viral video captures harassment of Indian couple
item.description: A viral video showed a racist attack on an Indian couple in Peterborough, Ontario, by Canadian teenagers. Now, the teenagers have found support from some social media users.&nbsp;

item.title: Top Losers and Gainers on Aug 12: Astral, Praj Industries, Bata India, KPR Mill, RVNL among top losers today
item.description: Indian equities fell on August 12, with the Nifty 50 down 0.40% and the S&amp;P BSE Sensex down 0.46%. Investors were cautious ahead of US inflation data, which could influence the Federal Reserve's interest rate decisions.

item.title: ‘Worst decision of ICICI Bank’: Influencers, netizens react to minimum balance rule
item.description: Ever since ICICI Bank's decision to increase its minimum balance was announced, netizens and influencers have taken their concerns to the social media platform X. The topic has sparked mixed emotions among the banking customers.

item.title: ‘Streets must be free & safe’: Chidambaram reacts to SC's order on stray dogs, says must be implemented in every city
item.description: The Supreme Court ordered Delhi authorities to immediately begin removing stray dogs from all localities and relocating them to shelters.

item.title: Stock market today: 114 stocks hit 52-week highs, 105 stocks at 52-week low as Nifty 50, Sensex end lower
item.description: Stock market today: The Indian stock market saw mixed results with 114 stocks at 52-week highs and 105 at lows. The BSE Sensex declined by 368 points, and Nifty 50 dropped by 97 points. Investors await key economic data and diplomatic discussions between the US and Russia.

item.title: Earthquake today: Magnitude 6.5 quake hits Papua in eastern Indonesia
item.description: However, a monitor said there was no tsunami threat yet.

item.title: Priyanka Gandhi accuses Israel of ‘genocide’ in Gaza; Envoy Reuven Azar responds: ‘Don’t buy Hamas numbers’
item.description: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has launched a scathing attack on Israel over its military offensive in Gaza, accusing the Israeli state of committing ‘genocide’ and criticising the Indian government for its ‘silence’ on the matter.

item.title: Multibagger engineering stock nears record high after THIS order book update. Check details
item.description: HBL Engineering shares surged over 4% on August 12 after securing an order from West Central Railway for KAVACH equipment installation. The contract, valued at ₹54.12 crore, covers 166 kilometres and 19 stations, boosting the company's total order book to ₹4,083.17 crore.

item.title: Bengaluru man leaves ₹1.2 crore job to support pregnant wife, internet applauds his decision
item.description: A Reddit user's story about quitting a lucrative job to support his pregnant wife sparked admiration and envy.

item.title: Hindalco Q1 Results: Profit jumps 30% to ₹4,004 crore; EBITDA rises 9% YoY
item.description: Hindalco Q1 Results: Hindalco Industries reported a 30% YoY increase in consolidated profit for Q1FY26, reaching ₹4,004 crore, up from ₹3,074 crore a year earlier. Revenue rose 12.7% YoY to ₹64,232 crore, while consolidated EBITDA increased 9% to ₹8,673 crore.

item.title: Amid demand hiccups, Apollo Tyres drives towards lifting earnings
item.description: The Apollo Tyres management expects demand recovery in FY26, but challenges remain, including competition from Balkrishna Industries.&nbsp;

item.title: Marksans Pharma share price slumps 14% to four-month low after weak Q1 results
item.description: Marksans Pharma shares fell 14.28% to ₹180 following a 35.8% YoY drop in net profit to ₹58.2 crore due to weak performances in key regions. Despite challenges, total revenue increased 5% YoY to ₹620 crore, bolstered by a 30.6% revenue rise in the US market.

item.title: ‘Edited and used without permission...’: Kay Kay Menon says he didn't act in Congress ‘Vote Chori’ ad featuring him
item.description: The actor commented on Congress's social media post in all caps and said that the clip had been taken from the promotional videos of the web series Special Ops and was ‘edited and used’ without permission.

item.title: Caught on camera: Hilarious street fight with police man as 'referee’ goes viral; Internet reacts, ‘Desi Liu Kang’
item.description: Footage of a chaotic street fight between two men has gone viral. A police man can be seen struggling to intervene to prevent the situation from becoming chaotic. Online users shared humorous comments and jokes, noting the police officer's unsuccessful attempts to control the fight.

item.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 trade volatile with resilience. Is this a signal for trend reversal?
item.description: Stock market experts are cautious in interpreting the rally as a structural turnaround. The consensus view is that current gains reflect a relief rally rather than a definitive trend reversal.

item.title: HAL Q1 Results: Profit dips 4% YoY to ₹1,377 crore, revenue rises 11%; share price rebounds
item.description: Q1 Results: HAL reported a 4.4% decline in profit during the April-June 2025 quarter at ₹1377.15 crore as against ₹1435.59 crore in the year-ago quarter. The revenues from operations at ₹4,819.14 crore, up 11%.

item.title: Star Imaging IPO subscribed 2.57x so far on third bidding day. Check GMP, issue details, more
item.description: The Star Imaging IPO is currently 2.57x subscribed, with retail portion at 1.12x. The company offers diagnostic services and aims to use proceeds for working capital and debt repayment. The IPO includes 34,40,000 fresh shares.

item.title: Teenager left with ₹30 lakh home loan after father’s death, asks for advice, ‘I’ve felt like giving up…’
item.description: A 19-year-old B.Tech student seeks help online after losing her father, the family's sole earner. Facing eviction due to a ₹30 lakh home loan, she struggles to support her uneducated mother and three younger sisters.

item.title: US-Russia talks: Indian stock market on back foot ahead of Trump-Putin meet. What should investors do?
item.description: According to Vijaykumar, investors should be guarded against the elevated valuations in the broader market, particularly in smallcaps.

item.title: Nifty IT Index rises 1% amid relief rally: Should you buy or sell IT stocks?
item.description: Stock Market today: The Nifty IT Index gained more than 1% during the morning trade on Tuesday amid a relief rally in the Indian stock market. However, analysts believe tarrif threat, weak earnings and valuations caution on IT stocks.

item.title: ‘So much death, how can one group of people decide fate of another?’: How journalists killed by Israel saw Gaza horror
item.description: Anas al-Sharif had broken into tears after a woman collapsed behind him from severe hunger. But he refused to leave the city. ‘I am talking about slow death of those people,’ he had said.

item.title: ISI-backed Babbar Khalsa International terror network busted, 5 held: Punjab Police
item.description: In a significant operation, the Punjab Police has dismantled a terror network supported by Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI). Five operatives were arrested, and a planned attack was foiled. The police recovered weapons and a grenade, highlighting ongoing security threats in the region.

item.title: Sectoral fund inflows soar 1,882% MoM: A smart move or costly mistake by Indian retail investors amid Trump tariff war?
item.description: While sectoral funds gained popularity with record inflows, analysts urge caution. They advise retail investors to diversify to mitigate risks, as historical trends indicate that concentrated investments in specific sectors often lead to underperformance in the long run.

item.title: INDIA bloc doubles down on ‘vote chori’, SIR protest—MPs wear T-shirts featuring ‘124-yr-old’ voter Minta Devi | Watch
item.description: INDIA bloc MPs protested in Parliament House against the Election Commission over alleged vote theft. They wore white T-shirts featuring ‘124-year-old’ voter Minta Devi, referenced by Rahul Gandhi in his earlier presentation, with '124 Not Out' printed on the back.

item.title: Trump's deal with Nvidia and AMD raises corporate & national security risks: What experts say
item.description: US President Donald Trump has brokered a deal allowing Nvidia and AMD to resume AI chip exports to China, in exchange for a 15% revenue cut for the US government, raising concerns among lawmakers about national security.

item.title: Viral video: Delhi man slammed for letting son urinate on metro railway tracks, ‘Most uncivilised people’
item.description: A Delhi man is criticised for allowing his son to urinate on the Inderlok Metro Station tracks, as captured in a viral video. Social media users condemned the act, calling for penalties.

item.title: Motilal Oswal sees this multibagger AMC stock rising 15% to fresh record high. Should you buy?
item.description: Motilal Oswal maintains a buy rating for Nippon Life Asset Management with a target price of ₹930. The firm highlights the company's rapid growth in the mutual fund sector, significant market share increase, and strong performance in ETFs and alternative investments.

item.title: HFC stock Sammaan Capital jumps 9% on reports of corporate shake-up. Check details
item.description: Sammaan Capital share price has fallen 2% in one month, but has gained 3% in three months. The housing finance stock has dropped 19% on a year-to-date (YTD) basis, while it has declined 15% in two years.

item.title: Ace investor Nimisha Pandey raises stake in THIS small-cap NBFC stock under ₹50
item.description: The ace investor has acquired 43,15,000 shares, taking her total stake in Paisalo Digital Limited to 4,67,32,362 shares, as per the filing.

item.title: Watch | War 2 actor Jr NTR loses temper at pre-release event, snap at fan, ‘Won’t take me a second to….’
item.description: War 2 actor Jr NTR lost temper at pre-release event. The 42-year-old Tollywood superstar confronted a loud fan and expressed displeasure over the disturbing behaviour.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi calls Supreme Court ruling on stray dogs ‘cruel’, says ‘voiceless souls are not problem’
item.description: Calling the Supreme Court ruling on stray dogs ‘cruel’ and ‘shortsighted’, Rahul Gandhi said the directive to remove all stray dogs was a step back from decades of humane policies.

item.title: INOX Green share price jumps after inking 182 MW wind project. Check details
item.description: Inox Green Energy shares rose by almost 5% following a deal for comprehensive O&amp;M of 182 MW wind projects. The contract covers upgrades and renewals, marking a significant milestone for the company and reinforcing client confidence in its capabilities.

item.title: Upcoming IPO: FourFront Limited receives BSE approval for SME IPO launch
item.description: Upcoming IPO: Forefront Limited has received a BSE approval for the SME IPO launch. Here are some of the key details from the DRHP

item.title: Cash-at-home row: Lok Sabha forms 3-member panel to probe allegations against Justice Yashwant Varma
item.description: &nbsp;Cash-at-home row: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla announced a three-member panel to probe allegations against Justice Yashwant Varma, linked to a cash scandal. The inquiry follows a motion signed by 146 MPs, reflecting rising concerns about judicial integrity in India.

item.title: Indian Hotels share price rises 1.5% after company's acquisition plans. Do you own this Tata group stock?
item.description: Indian Hotels Company, the operator of the Taj Group, posted a net profit of ₹296 crore for the first quarter of the current financial year, up 19% from ₹248 crore in the same quarter last year.

item.title: Banks drive Aussie shares to record high as RBA cuts rates for third time in 2025
item.description: AUSTRALIA-STOCKS/ CLOSE:Banks drive Aussie shares to record high as RBA cuts rates for third time in 2025
